dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think this dream might be sexual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinkin'. The sword is my cock and I can't get it up, but that ain't it. I saw Sheila last night and I had a hard-on you could swing from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coulda hung wet towels on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like a racehorse in that area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!   I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to  Jelly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait in the  car! (to  Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does  it mean? Ben sits on the wicker divan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex can represent a lot of things. In your case I think it's about performance anxiety. Trying to find a job that fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc -- nothing's gonna fit. That nine-to-five bullshit -- I'll fuckin' kill myself if I have to do that for the rest of my life. You know they take taxes out of your check? What the fuck is that? I'm doomed. I'm gonna end up selling hot dogs on the street. (starts breathing hard and sweating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. I'm havin' a fuckin' panic attack here. My heart's beatin' like a rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He empties the drugstore bag and hands it to Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe into this. Vitti sits on a wicker chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaks through bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tellin' me I have to get a job like I'm some fuckin' nobody. It was humiliating! Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps up, in a total rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm doing the best I can!     If you can't appreciate that, or if my    best isn't good enough for you, then    maybe you should find somebody else to    talk to, you selfish prick! Ben breaks down and cries what amounts to one racking sob then quickly pulls himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.    I'm grieving.   It's a process. Ben takes a pill bottle out of his pocket and pops a coup of pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what are you takin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echinacea and goldenseal. Do you know the TV show 'Little Caesar'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The producer of that show is a man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: named Raoul Berman. A mutual friend told him I knew you and Mr. Berman called me this morning. He wants to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet him and find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Laura walk up to a trendy Japanese restaurant in Chelsea. Ben is really keyed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We finally got him out of the house -- why are we having dinner with him? I mean, how professional is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not social. Paul's meeting a television producer who might have a job for him. He's nervous and wants me here as a buffer. I'm a buffer, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a grown man. I don't see why he needs a chaperone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't. He needs a buffer.    I'm here in buffer capacity only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, if you say 'buffer' one more time
Ben pops a couple of pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you just take two of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that was something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you better not drink anything. You know what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura? I'm a doctor?     I think I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben opens the door and motions for Laura to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, behind her back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cerrone and Miller watch the front of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all inside. We're going to get something to eat. We'll be back before they finish dinner. They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at a table are Ben and    Laura, Vitti and Sheila, and the producer RAOUL BERMAN    and his uptight, downtow GIRLFRIEND. Jelly inspects a     piece of raw octopus, wh Raoul gushes over a platter of    sushi and sashimi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I adore this place. Best sushi in town. Have you tried the yellowtail, Paul? Raoul picks up a floppy piece of raw fish with his chopsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes a face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We gettin' any real food?     This is like eatin' fuckin' bait. Raoul chuckles and glances uncomfortably at his girlfrien Ben laughs loudly to cover the awkward moment. He's suffering from some reaction between the pills and the bo and he's oddly thick-lipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bait! That's funny. Honey, did you hear what Paul just said? He said this is like eating bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard him. And I think it was 'effing bait.'

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: Why you talkin' like that?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: Like a fuckin' retard.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (pointing to his lower lip) Oh -- this? I took a couple ibuprofen before we got here -- I shouldn't have had the saki. I'll be fine. It only lasts a couple hours. (to Raoul) Rah-oo. Row. Rowl. I guess you need both lips for that name. You know what I love about Paul? He was born without a filter. He says exactly what he's thinking -- just lays it right out there. He doesn't edit himself.

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: (quietly) You wanna shut the fuck up?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: See? He just told me to shut the fuck up. No filter. I love that. (to Raoul) Isn't he great?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: (aside to Ben) Too much buffering. Way too much.

dialogues.speaker: RAOUL
dialogues.text: (eyeing Ben oddly) Yes. Paul, I'm such a huge fan of yours -- not a fan, but you know, an admirer.

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: Don't admire me too much.

dialogues.speaker: RAOUL
dialogues.text: Is there any chance you might be interested in working on 'Little Caesar' as a consultant? Give us technical advice, coach the actors, make sure the dialogue rings true --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That would be incredible. Did you hear that, Paul? Raoul wants to know if you'd be interested in working on his show as a consultant. You know, give technical advice, coach the actors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In two seconds I'm gonna put a fork in your eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly cowed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so exciting. Mr. Berman, I love your show. Anthony Bella, the guy who plays Nicky Caesar -- I think he grew up in Bensonhurst next door to my cousin's friend's husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her claim to fame. (to Sheila)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to bust your bubble, but he's not from Bensonhurst. He's a professional Italian. He grew up in Connecticut or something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wherever he's from, I think he's a wonderful actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bet he gets a lot of pussy. Laura chokes on her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?   We got women at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said 'fuckin'.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's different. It's colorful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, speaking of colorful -- this peacock walks into a bar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god. (to a passing waiter, rising her half-empty drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I get another one, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    No more for the Buffer. She glares at Ben as the table descends into silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries a desperate save)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. I see in the paper where Oklahoma! might win the Tony award. Vitti's eyes suddenly go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down!!! He grabs Sheila and pulls her down as GUNFIRE rakes the w behind them. Everybody else at the table hits the floor. Other diners scream in terror.    Jelly pulls a GUN and S back.

dialogues.speaker: A LONE GUNMAN
dialogues.text: runs from the restaurant. After a long beat, the frighten patrons start to get up and chatter nervously.

dialogues.speaker: BEN'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Nobody's hurt.   Vitti helps Sheila to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think somebody's got it in for Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul crawls up from behind the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit. (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was phenomenal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly stands in front of an apartment building parking garage. A guy comes walking up the ramp toward him. As he comes nearer, we see that the guy is the Gunman from the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal -- got a light? The guy stops, pulls out a Zippo and lights it for Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to cut down. The Gunman recognizes Jelly and desperately reaches for t gun in his pocket, but Jelly hauls off and whacks the guy across the back of the head with a sap. As  he slumps int Jelly's arms, Vitti steps out of a doorway and Jelly drag the gunman into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Laura are getting ready for bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why you feel you have to save this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job.   He needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that automatically means you have to help him? You're always doing this -- putting other people's needs ahead of your own, like you're this martyr or saint or something. It's like living with Mother Teresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I hear she was tough to live with. Lot of parties, loud music -- lepers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need this in your life -- especially not now. You really need to be grieving for your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   I haven't seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, it's a process. I mean, we had issues -- there's some anger -- but I'll work it out. Laura goes to Ben and embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, honey. You can let it go. Ben almost starts to break, but he holds it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm -- it's okay. Ben sits heavily on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a confusing time. I became a therapist because he was a therapist, so obviously his approval was very important to me. But is that the only reason I did it? I don't know. And now that he's gone, why do I keep doing it? Is this what I really want? She sits next to him and takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to be happy. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. (kisses her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time I started focusing on me, and, you know, satisfying some of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: my desires. He looks at her expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, I just brushed my teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not what I meant.     I just need -- (at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what. She puts her arms around him and holds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti and Jelly stand with the Gunman on the roof of the parking garage, four stories above the ground. The guy's arms are bound. Jelly ties a rope around his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna ask you once nicely.     Who you working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me?    Fine. Jelly? Jelly shoves the guy to the parapet at the edge of the ro grabs him by the legs and hangs him over the side of the building. The guy screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask you again.     Who you working for? The guy keeps screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's screamin' too loud.     Hold on a second. Jelly swings the guy against the building, hitting his he and dazing him momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop him, Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay!    Rigazzi!   I'm working for Rigazzi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull him back up. Jelly drops the guy. The Gunman plunges three stories and lands heavily in a dumpster full of garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said drop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said pull him back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what you wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you got me there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "family" business in Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light from outside barely penetrates the painted wind of the shabby office. LOU RIGAZZI, aka "Lou the Wrench," the aging boss of the Rigazzi family, sits in the half-light as a couple of his soldiers enter with the battered and hobbling Gunman betw them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti threw me off a roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti? You talked to Vitti?     What did you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I didn't tell him anything. Mr. Rigazzi, can I go -- I think my leg's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must hurt. Rigazzi pulls out a GUN with a silencer and SHOOTS the Gunman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to see people in pain. (to soldiers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Vitti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a hard man to kill. But he's not immortal. Our time will come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, family barbecue is going on in a back yard in Quee Several children are splashing in an over-sized, above-gr swimming pool. Oddly, the children appear to be shouting laughing but make no sound. At the barbecue, Nicky Caesar is watching his friend MELL turn Italian sausage on the grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like mine burnt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you like your sausage? Twenty fuckin' years we been doin' this. So you got the money? The wind shifts and blows the smoke from the barbecue in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughing, eyes watering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all of it. I'm still light about fifteen large. (blinded by smoke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we cut? This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut! Can you do something about the fucking smoke? We PULL BACK to reveal the set of "Little Caesar." Assist directors and production assistants echo the director: "We're cut!" "Reset!" "Effects!" Vitti observes the action sitting in a director's chair, still brooding over the previous night's events. Raoul si next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the problem with shooting on location. But it's worth it for the authenticity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is real authentic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony! Come here a second. (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony Bella. He plays Nicky Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who he is. They used to watch the show up at Sing Sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you shitting me? ANTHONY BELLA joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, this is Paul Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Australian accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me who he is. (shakes Paul's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure, mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting to accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mate? I don't believe this! You're an English guy? You ain't even Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Australian-Italian. We got some paisans down under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down under what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tony Bella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How incredible is this? Paul tells me they watch the show in Sing Sing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic!    That's so fuckin' great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't wet my pants over it.      They watch 'Supermarket Sweep,' too. Raoul laughs hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You laugh too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Paul, you going to join us? Vitti looks around, his future plans now beginning to for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    You got a good setup here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   See you later then. He exits.   Vitti turns to Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupla things, though. I don't know who makes these decisions, but some of this, it don't look right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sensed it myself. Which elements strike you as wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people mainly. I mean, you got a boss who speaks Australian. What the fuck is that? And I'm guessing your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: background is -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The theater, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the theater. So how about if I bring in some guys that I know -- you know, more 'authentic.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be eternally grateful. Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. One of those trailers like the stars have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight hesitation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. (shakes his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put that in the works right now. He hurries off to talk to his assistant.   Jelly comes up Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really gonna do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' way. I've had it with this job bullshit. A week of this and I'd either shoot myself or shoot Raoul. But it's good cover while I figure out my next move. Call the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly and Vitti's old crew, MO-MO, BIGS, TUNA, EDDIE COKE and eight or nine other wiseguys walk en masse into base camp. Vitti's guys go to the front of the lunch line, forcing t crew aside. A big, pop-out trailer labeled "Mr. Vitti," guarded by th of his guys. Tuna brings a lunch tray and knocks on the door. Jelly opens the door and takes the tray. Vitti conferring with Raoul and Tony Bella on the script,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ripping out whole sections. Vitti in the makeup trailer getting a haircut and manicur while he smokes a cigar and talks on his cell phone. Vitti with the costumer, approving and nixing various wardrobe choices, while Jelly steals an expensive watch i the b.g. Vitti in a massage chair getting a backrub from a masseus A PRODUCTION ASSISTANT approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready to start shooting, Mr. Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, ten minutes, tell 'em. Eddie Devol, Patty LoPresti's guy, watches Vitti from a s distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes out of the market carrying several grocery bags a small prescription bag. Two Mafia SOLDIERS step up besi him and urge him toward a big stretch LIMO IDLING at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some mistake.    I didn't order a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters timorously, still carrying his groceries. Patty LoPresti, Masiello and a couple of other heavyweigh are sitting at the table, all except Patti smoking cigars Ben immediately recognizes their status and grasps the gravity of their mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous, but trying to keep it light)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.   I'm Ben Sobel. And you are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldier sits Ben down. The other soldier takes his groceries. Ben looks at Patty, trying to gauge her role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the shrink who's taking care of Paul Vitti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. That's right. (to guy with groceries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you be careful, because I think they put the eggs on the bottom. He drops the bags heavily onto the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?    Is he nuts or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie.     Is he nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't discuss a patient's case with anyone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discuss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say he's still suffering from chronic anxiety and -- He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call it Antisocial Personality Disorder. Sociopathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning -- he -- fails to conform to societal norms with respect to -- lawful behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a fuckin' headache here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a -- criminal temperament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a criminal? This is news? And for that you need a doctor degree? So what are you doin' with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm trying to at least show him the possibility of change --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong.   You do not want him to change. Ben looks at her, sensing her command of the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't really been introduced --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mrs. LoPresti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben Sobel. Ben offers his hand but she ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Paul Vitti is important to this family. We don't want to see you turn him into a stromboni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stromboni? That thing they clean the ice with at hockey games?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a Zamboni, asshole.   Stromboni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bull with his balls cut off. She reaches under the table and grabs Ben's balls.    He in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeezed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you want to be one, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Me? No. I'm very attached to my balls. As you can probably tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lets go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do the right thing, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (greatly relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand completely. May I go now? I have perishables -- He takes his groceries and edges away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is sitting at a table with Jelly and some of his ma guys. From a distance it looks like they're playing cards Up close it's a different story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need a grapple or a crane with maybe a fifty-foot boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen one -- in Bayonne -- but I'll call around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what you can come up with.   And we're gonna need a city bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a guy in the Transit Authority. He owes me. Just let me know when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!   Hello! Vitti turns to see Patty, Eddie Devol and his men heading across the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess everybody's gone Hollywood, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', Patty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly -- you're working here, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extra what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A supernumerary. An 'atmosphere.' It ain't bad. You just stand around all day waitin' for them to shoot and they pay you eighty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty bucks? For standin' around all day? You used to sneeze eighty bucks. How much you make shootin' craps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today?   About eight hundred maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how about bookin' bets for the Teamsters and the crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another grand. One of the producers really likes the ponies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So eighteen hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus eighty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -- extra. They all laugh. An ASSISTANT DIRECTOR approaches the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a closed set. We're about to start shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?    So am I. Eddie grabs the Assistant Director and walks him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks and trailers are arranged on a parking lot. pulls up and Lou Rigazzi gets out with his bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I wait here, Mr. Rigazzi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, pull the car up your ass and wait there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty takes Vitti's arm and walks with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you had some more trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Rigazzi's guys took a shot at me. She stops at the extras' makeup table and starts primping the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to tell you, Paul. Alone on the street you don't stand a chance. That's what the family's all about. Since the old days, when the grandfathers first came over. That's not something you just walk away from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. When you're a Jet, you're a Jet all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want to tell me what's going on here? It looks like you got your whole crew back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going on.   They're actors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me, Paul. You're planning something. I'm feeling very left out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Something big is going down, but you're getting a cut. My hand to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good friend, Paul. And I would never think of insisting on this, but I'd feel better if you brought in Eddie and some of my guys to help with the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll have to insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Raoul approaches and eyes Patty disdainfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear God. First of all, sweetheart, we're not shooting the hooker scene until tomorrow. And the hair -- please, what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul, this is a friend of mine. Patty LoPresti. Raoul freezes, recognizing the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. LoPresti -- I am so very, very Raoul wheels on a production assistant who happens to be passing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you not inform me Mrs. LoPresti was on the set. You're fired! (to Patty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your visit with us. If there's anything I can do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately. Raoul moves away quickly.   Patty turns back to Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to have you back, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kisses Vitti on the cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be in touch. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Patty and her men walk away down one aisle of trucks a campers, Rigazzi and his men walk down the next aisle hea for the set. They narrowly miss seeing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben arrives looking for Vitti. He       sees Patty approa freezes, then quickly ducks behind      a nearby truck, s his crotch. Patty and her men pass       by. Ben waits un pass, then comes out of hiding and      hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mildly-distraught Raoul is huddled with Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, tell me -- was she angry?    Am I in any danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're fine. But you might want to have somebody else start your car the next couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have Brian do it.   He's new. Rigazzi and his men join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Rigazzi)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what is this now, the bus and truck tour of Guys and Dolls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lou Rigazzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a horrified whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Wrench.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Rigazzi's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, forgive me. I'm on painkillers -- half the time I don't know what I'm saying. Raoul kisses Rigazzi's hand.     Rigazzi yanks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. (as he exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian! Get my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti and Rigazzi stand at the table.     Rigazzi's soldi nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who shot at you -- he was acting on his own. I never gave an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's been taken care of. There won't be another incident. Unless you're thinkin' of workin' for Patty LoPresti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?    No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.    Then I got no beef with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    I'll sleep much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because   that would not be the way to go. You    want to back a winner, which is gonna   be me. It only makes sense. You come   work for us. I'll treat you right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so much for sleeping better. Rigazzi smiles and pats Vitti's cheek, then exits with hi soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks in and sees Vitti's guys sitting around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dr. Sobel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly, hi. (recognizing some of the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Yo-Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mo-Mo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I was thinking of the cellist. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' good. I did a 'Law and Order' last week, I had a line on 'Sex and the City' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up for a recurring on 'NYPD Blue.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.    Have you seen Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think he's in his camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a loud KNOCK on the door and Ben storms in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to see him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what are   you doing here? I came to tell you   we have a preliminary meeting with   your parole officer and who do I run   into? Patty LoPresti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this -- a knock-knock joke? Patty-who-kidnapped-me-and-threatened- to-cut-off-my-balls. Stop lying to me, Paul. Your whole gang is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says I'm lying? I finally    get a straight job and start putting   my life in order and you come in here   and start accusing me! That's how    much you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off   balance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that   I don't trust you, I just don't --   trust you.   Are you lying to me?    Because I know you, Paul. You'll    say or do anything to get your own   way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what's so hard about being an ex-con. You make one little mistake in your life and people never let you forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so now you're the victim?    I want the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.    Say that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I want the truth.'   Say it -- like you did just now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, strong, like before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forceful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious. That had power. I believed it. You could be an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an actor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're as good as most of the bums I see around here. They have this part. You could do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I did The Music Man in tenth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.   I'm gonna talk to Raoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About being on the show?   I couldn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this part you could do.   It's perfect. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action!

dialogues.speaker: ON ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Jelly and Tony Bella drag Ben kicking and screaming to th edge of the roof and hang him over the edge. On the ground, Raoul and Vitti look up, watching the acti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doubtful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that screaming sound real to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.    That sounds real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben drives, pissed off.       Vitti chuckles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not funny! There was no safety harness or anything. They could have dropped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if you didn't want to do it, why didn't you say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what that was about. You resent the fact that you've been put in my custody, so you passive- aggressively arranged things to make me look like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- you were great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on a dime)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I was scared at first, but on the second take, I think I found some good stuff. I was able to texture the screaming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, screw you, Paul.   Just screw you. He pops two pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you self-medicating again? And don't give that decongestant multi-vitamin bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me. Just worry about what you're going to say to this parole officer. What are you going to say? That you've moved out of my house. That you've got your old gang back together. For what, a high school drop-out reunion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna say that's none of his fuckin' business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my business. I want to know. I'm a federal institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks side- view mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You recognize that car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that's been following us the last mile and a half. Ben jerks his head around to look and sees a black Merced behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, 'lose 'em'? Vitti stomps his foot down on Ben's, flooring the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's car speeds up suddenly. The black Mercedes behind h speeds up, too, as does a third car that has joined the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is on the edge of panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should just pull over.   It could be the F.B.I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're two cars back. You gotta be a little more observant, Doc. Turn left. Ben executes a hard, SKIDDING left.   The Benz stays righ with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we just stop and get out? They're not going to shoot us in broad daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broad daylight's the best time. You can see better. Take a right. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedestrians scatter as Ben makes a sudden turn into a ban drive-thru. He over-steers and wipes out an ATM machine, sending up a cloud of bills that flutter down like confet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: follows right behind him, then the bystanders run to pick the cash, blocking the drive-thru, forcing Miller in the car to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two police officers are parked at the curb. They hear a H HONKING, and turn just as Ben's car comes flying past the The cops start to pull out but stop short as the Benz blo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: by, swerving to avoid hitting them.    The cops take off pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do this, Paul!     We have to stop! This is a lease! GUNFIRE SHATTERS the rear WINDOW of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back at the Mercedes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a goddamn lease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move over. I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move over?   Where? Vitti puts his left foot on the gas pedal and his left ha on the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backseat.    Now! Ben tries to launch himself into the backseat but is stop by his seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seat belt. He releases the belt, then twists and crawls over the top the driver's seat into the back, while Vitti slides into driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's car races past an industrial area with the Mercedes right on its tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's car bounces over some railroad tracks and sails int warehouse complex on the river with the Mercedes still on few car lengths behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti drives down the narrow lane between two big warehou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna get worse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti rockets out from between buildings and races throug parking lot toward the river with the Benz on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right behind us! (shouts at them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away! He starts whipping things out the shattered back window - tennis racket, sneakers, an empty Macy's box.

dialogues.speaker: TENNIS RACKET
dialogues.text: is crushed under the Mercedes' wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben picks up the only thing left -- the New York Times. starts leafing through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to save the crossword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw it! Bent throws the paper out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Times hits the windshield and one double-page sticks, totally OBSCURING the driver's VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti throws a 180, SKIDDING to a stop just inches from t river's edge. The Benz, with the newspaper covering the windshield, sails past them and right off the embankment. seems to hang in the air for a long time, then lands with big splash and starts to sink almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: BEN AND VITTI
dialogues.text: They jump out of the car and watch the Mercedes disappear under the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'll get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's James Bond and the 'Sea Hunt' guy in there, so they got a pretty good shot. They hear POLICE SIRENS APPROACHING. Vitti starts walking away quickly. Ben follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take care of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your parole officer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send my regrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you. If you leave now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Doc. Vitti takes off running, ducking behind the rows of parke cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! I'm finished! You're on your own now, pal! I'm -- POLICE CARS and the FBI CAR SCREECH into the parking lot surround Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police divers search for the sunken Mercedes in the middl the channel. On shore, Ben leans against a government car looking tire and distraught while Chapin berates him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he, Dr. Sobel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, considering that he's in your custody, that's not quite the answer I was looking for. He's got something big in the works. You want to tell me what you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything. As far as I can tell, he's making a real effort to go straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's why I've got two corpses at the bottom of the river. He reaches through the open car window into his briefcase pulls out a file of photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Vitti with Sal Masiello. Vitti with Patty LoPresti. Vitti with Lou Rigazzi. Let me know -- I can order some wallet size for you. I've got more than enough to put him away again without these. Violation of parole, second-degree murder here. When I really start digging, it'll be amazing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: what I come up with. You have twenty- four hours to find him and deliver him to me. Otherwise you're looking at obstruction of justice, and accessory to felony manslaughter. And trust me, Dr. Sobel, if you don't like me now, you really don't want to see me in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting that.   Can I go now? He starts for his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take your car. We're impounding it as evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then can somebody give me a ride home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the government runs a limousine service. The number is 1-800-Fuck Off. Chapin walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is hurriedly collecting his stuff, talking to Jelly a few of his old gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a lot of time. They're probably gonna come lookin' for me, so we'll go over everything later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, not that I'm questioning, but what do we want with Eddie DeVol? Guy's a fuckin' scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not happy about it, but if it keeps Patty off my back, so be it. They're meeting us at the club. Let's head out. (as they all get up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all at once. I gotta tell you everything? A PRODUCTION ASSISTANT KNOCKS and sticks her head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti? Mr. Bella asked if you could meet him in the makeup trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it was important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him tomorrow. He hands the P.A. some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- tell him you couldn't find me. Vitti exits.   The P.A. looks at the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti makes his way past the trailers, heading for his ca As he passes the makeup trailer, the door opens and Tony Bella sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!   Excellent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't really talk right now, mate. Headin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two seconds. Please, Paul.    It's really important. Vitti looks pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti watches impatiently while the makeup artist touches Tony Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (script in hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for something to do when my character finds out he's being indicted. I was thinking of punching the wall, but I did that when they killed Uncle Lenny, and I did it again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: when Franny left me. Oh, and I punched a car, a van actually, when Peezee screwed up the big drug deal. So I'd like to find something different, that doesn't involve, you know, punching anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try kickin' something.   Let me know how it works out. Vitti starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Paul.   That's interesting.    Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You could kick a guy in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some guy! You knock him down, give him a couple quick kicks in the head while he's on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Because he's there and you're pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe once or twice.   Look, I got people waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it, decides not)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My character wouldn't do that.   What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss, getting angrier)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You could yell real loud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yell real loud? That's original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or keep your fuckin' mouth shut! Who gives a shit what you do, for cryin' out loud? Tony Bella likes something about Vitti's inflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitates him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit what you do, for cryin' out loud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you can cut that shit out right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you can cut that shit out right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm serious, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm serious, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open and Tony Bella comes flying out of th trailer backwards, hitting the pavement hard. Vitti charg out of the trailer and storms away. Tony wipes blood from under his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good.     My character could do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab pulls up to the house, and Ben gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up the driveway and sees Jelly's car parked at t back door and a big man in a dark suit and tie wiping the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly!   Where's Paul? The guy in the suit turns.   It's Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?   What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a job? That's great. Look how handsome you look in that suit. What's the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working for Mr. Vitti.   I'm his driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, you're not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep telling me to get a job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant making sandwiches at the Subway, not driving a getaway car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's paying me twenty dollars an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if he pays you two hundred an hour, you're not doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had no right to ask you without my permission. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you can't tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised I'd never repeat anything I heard in the car. I took an oath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took an oath! Oh, my God!     Was there blood involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I gave my word. Laura comes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben? Where've you been?    What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (minimizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was  in a car chase. There  was a little  shooting -- not that much really  -- then they -- drove into the river.   It wasn't as bad as it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When is this going to end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, I hope. I just have to find him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? A few days ago you weren't even sure you still wanted to be a therapist. Now you're going to risk your life again for that lout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he's an amazing lout, isn't he? I can't quit now. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.   Just don't get shot -- please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. They kiss.     Then Ben turns to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell your father right now or I'll give you such a smack it won't even be funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!   I dropped him at the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Darling's in Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mafiaboy, give me your car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm grounded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm borrowing your car. He kisses Laura again and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several limos are parked outside a family-owned nightclub Queens. Ben pulls up, leaning way back in the driver's seat of Michael's, half-painted, modified '82 Honda Civic with th BUBBLING MUFFLERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben takes out a bottle of pills. He tries to remove the child-safety cap but his hands are shaking so badly he ca do it. Frustrated, he tries to bite the cap off, then giv up and throws the bottle away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters the club. A moment later, Cerrone and Miller cruise by in an unmark car and park at the end of the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters the nightclub and starts moving through the cr looking for Vitti. He pushes through and sees Jelly and a few of the guys watching an exotic dancer, a beautiful young blonde in a skimpy costume, standing on a platform grinding in mock ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over music)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc. What are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Paul? Jelly tucks a few bills into her G-string.     She looks and winks suggestively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she likes you, Doc.     Give her a couple of bucks. Ben reluctantly digs in his pocket and holds out a bill t the stripper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you break a twenty? The stripper sensuously fingers the top of her G-string, Ben gingerly sticks the twenty in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I just make my own change? He tentatively reaches for some smaller bills in her G-st but she dances away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ten and five ones -- when you have the chance. He turns around to talk to Jelly, but he's already gone. Ben finds Jelly at a table with Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Paul, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keyed up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could ask you the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it look like? We're just blowin' off a little steam. What's the big deal? Eddie DeVol enters, flanked by his main guys, AL PACINO a ENORMOUS BOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it goin', Paulie? You know my guys -- Enormous Bobby and Al Pacino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al Pacino? That's your real name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. People call me that because I look like Al Pacino. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody ever call you Carol Burnett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you look about as much like Carol Burnett as you look like Al Pacino. Ben laughs.   Al Pacino glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do see a little Pacino there -- around the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're all here. Let's do it. He heads for the back of the club with his guys.   Vitti Jelly start to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lays a hand on his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going until you tell me what's going on here. Vitti violently shakes off Ben's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me hurt you.    Get the fuck out of here. He walks away leaving Ben frozen. Ben watches as they disappear through a door leading to t back of the club. He starts toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is seated at a big table in the crowded, smoke-fill room. Jelly sits at  his side. He's surrounded by his cre about a half-a-dozen guys, and Patty's man, Eddie DeVol. Several street maps and diagrams are spread out on the ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is big and we only get one shot at it; and there's only about a million ways this fuckin' thing can go bad, so listen up. Vitti pulls a street map to the center of the table and t a spot downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federal Gold Depository in Lower Manhattan. Three times a year a shipment of gold bars goes in a heavily-guarded armored truck from the Depository to the vault at the Federal Reserve to hold for foreign governments that trade in bullion. At three o'clock in the morning -- eight hours from now --we're gonna hijack that truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters the back room of the club, looks around, and starts down the stairwell leading to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben makes his way down the cramped, dimly-lit stairway an approaches the door to the basement room. He raises his hand to knock, then hesitates and stands th for a moment listening to the MUFFLED VOICES inside. Suddenly he is grabbed from behind and slammed up against door by Enormous Bobby. Bobby slams him against the door couple of more times, using Ben's head as a doorknocker. door is opened by someone inside and Enormous Bobby shove Ben into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hits the floor to a chorus of surprised reactions fro the guys. Enormous Bobby pulls Ben off the floor by his lapels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this guy listening at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben Sobel. Sorry, I can't move my head to the right. Boy, I hope that's not permanent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of him. Al Pacino puts his gun to Ben's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dead man, asshole.    Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts muscling Ben to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? He can make every guy in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not into that, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your fuckin' hands off him!   He's with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, on the job? Vitti hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either he's in, or he's dead.    Which is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think in is better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in. He's my responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, no more surprises. And from this moment on, no one leaves my sight. Got it? Now go through it one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- everybody listen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! (sits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents Cerrone and Miller watch the front of the club fro their car parked across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawns, checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what it costs to keep that many limos waiting for three-and-a- half hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen men looking like Vitti and his crew come out of t club and get into the limos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody stand by. They're leaving. The limos drive off. At the corner, the FBI car pulls out and follows at a discreet distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI car follows the limos across the bridge into Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limos pull up at the WWF Restaurant.     The FBI car up the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 312, all units. W.W.F. Restaurant. Times Square. The limo doors open and the passengers get out -- all nondescript nobodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller watches intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Vitti?   I don't see Vitti. Cerrone stares with the growing awareness that they've be had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly, into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it off. We lost them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti's guys are dressed like construction workers as the load their gear into two trucks. Vitti supervises while others work on a New York City bus. Eddie DeVol, Al Pacino and Enormous Bobby stand guard ove the whole scene, in case anyone is thinking of defecting. Ben is wearing heavy dungarees and an oversized plaid shi struggling to lace his work boots. Jelly approaches him a tosses a bulletproof vest on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. See if this'll fit under your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could fit you under my shirt.    Don't they have anything smaller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't Bloomingdale's. Nobody knew you were comin'. You're lucky you're alive, Doc. He glances at Eddie DeVol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's going to be alive when this is over. What kind of plan is this? It's crazy. It's stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it. It may be crazy but it ain't stupid. If you want to stay alive, just keep your mouth shut, do everything I tell you and try not to pee in your pants. (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you handle an M-16? He holds up an automatic rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean shoot it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean twirl it like a fuckin' baton. How about an A.K.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up another rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rummaging through pile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kalashnikov, MAC-10, Uzi -- stop me if I hit one you like. Ben sees Eddie watching him and gingerly picks up a 9mm handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't I just take this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's a good one. That gun brings back a lot of fond memories. Use it in good health. Ben puts the gun into the waistband of his dungarees, but slips through and drops into his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, cold -- cold. He jams his hand down the front of his pants and starts searching around in there. Eddie and Enormous Bobby stare him as they walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gun -- fell down in my -- He shakes his leg and the gun drops out of his cuff and clatters onto the floor. He smiles weakly and picks it up Vitti approaches.    He looks agitated but under tight co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jelly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the bus. Jelly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to   Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can, I'm gonna   get you out before the real shit   goes down. Just don't flip out on me,   okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are making a huge mistake.   You know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it yourself.   It's my nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your nature!   You have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, fucking Jiminy Cricket? I don't know what planet you live on, but here on Earth it's 'might makes right.'   Read the papers. The guys with the guns make the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the pistol)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess that makes me a real man now.  What happened to the white hat, Paul?  Your father wasn't wrong. You could be one of the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Say one more word about my father and I'll break your fuckin' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Vitti walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti comes in, locks the door and has a full-blown panic attack -- gasping for breath, sweating, whimpering, tryin stifle his panic. Then he sees his tortured face in the mirror and starts pulling himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are getting into the trucks. Ben keeps letting everybody go in front of him, then starts to back away, b Eddie and Enormous Bobby come up behind him and push him into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big doors open and two trucks roll out carrying Vitti Ben and the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are sitting on the floor in the back of the truc lined up along the sides like paratroopers waiting to jum Ben is sitting next to Jelly and across from Vitti who is just staring intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks make their way past the aircraft carrier Intre heading downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti, Ben, and Eddie DeVol stand next to the treads of a giant crane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have five to three. They should start movin' any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have three-o-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see your watch. Ben slips it off and hands it to him. Vitti smashes it on rock with the butt of his gun, then tosses it back to Ben Vitti's RADIO SQUAWKS and the spotter's voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're moving! Vitti keys his radio twice as a signal and holds up his clenched fist to alert the guys on site with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONVOY of vehicles emerges from the bowels of the build and turns onto the street. In front and back are speciall equipped SUVs, full of heavily-armed federal marshals; an armored truck in the middle carries the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy RUMBLES past a block-long, high-rise construct site, totally enclosed by a plywood wall around the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: He can hear the convoy passing outside the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SPOTTER
dialogues.text: He looks down on the convoy from a vantage point on a scaffold high above the street. When the trucks are in th right position, he waves to Vitti on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: sees the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on walkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forty-foot, flat-bed trailer truck loaded with cement conduit backs across the street and stops, blocking the p of the convoy. The lead SUV HONKS. The truck doesn't move. The CAPTAIN o the marshals gets out and walks up to the truck. The driv has slipped out the other side and disappeared. Suddenly, a huge steel claw drops down from above and clo around the top of the armored truck, its sharp points crunching into the metal sides. Then the truck starts ris off the pavement. A couple of determined marshals jump ou of their vehicles, race over and grab onto the bumpers as armored truck is lifted off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred-foot tower crane lifts the truck straight up. T marshals hang on as long as they can, then prudently let and drop heavily to the street. Two marshals are still clinging to the truck as it rises to a height of thirty f then swings silently over the perimeter fencing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of arc lights is switched on illuminating the site the truck is lowered to the ground. Heavily-armed gangste in ski masks surround the truck and herd the driver, the shotgun guard and the frightened marshals into a construction shack, while men with acetylene torch attack the back doors. Vitti pulls down his ski mask and taps Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, it's not too late.   Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. He strides off to take charge. Ben pulls down his mask an hurries after him, but runs right into a pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!   Ow! He raises his mask and scampers after Vitti rubbing the painful bump on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marshals run around, frantically searching for a way the construction site.

dialogues.speaker: VITTI
dialogues.text: Totally in charge, he strides up to the armored truck jus his men finish cutting through the steel plate doors. Vit yanks the doors open.. Vitti and Ben stare in awe at the exposed contents of the truck -- a fortune in gold bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the ramp! Eddie and his guys run up with a long, narrow track with metal rollers and set it up at the rear of the gold truck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this might just fuckin' work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get in so much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marshals are trying to climb over the construction si wall, but they're stopped by rolls of razor wire and SUPPRESSING FIRE from inside the site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't get over the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then knock down the gates!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys take the heavy bars out of the armored truck and them quickly along the rolling track into the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly is pulling on the hat and jacket of a transit autho bus driver. The floor boards of the bus have been lifted and the guys are laying the gold bars in the hollow under floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pops his head in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty bars. That's all we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $350 an ounce, 16 ounces in a pound, 90 pounds in each bar -- do the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, gold is measured in troy ounces. 14.6 ounces to the pound. That would be... $18,396,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give or take. He hears a LOUD CRASH and all eyes turn to the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so much for not peeing in my pants. Eddie goes off to help transfer the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marshals back up one of the SUVs and run it into the gates again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big, wooden GATES SHUDDER but Vitti's men roll two enormous earthmovers up to reinforce the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you said about not flipping out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?
