dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (flipping out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? What did I do? I had a perfect life, I threw it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this. Vitti drags him off toward the building structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it! My life is over! I'm going to jail. Some people can handle prison -- I'm not one of them. I have delicate features. I'm small. I'll be way too popular!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't calm down!      I'm gonna die! Inside the structure, Vitti spins him around and shakes h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe! I'm suffocating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Chrissake, get hold of yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!   I'm dying!   We're all going to die! Suddenly, he slaps Vitti hard across the face.      They freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I just hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Feel better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Paul. I blame myself for this. I wanted to help you. I wanted to be there for you. But I just wasn't good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were good.  It isn't your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it is. Since my father died -- (starts crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost my way. I don't know anything anymore. I mean, what's the point? I didn't think it would hit me so hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you just shut up about your father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm grieving, goddammit!    Have a little respect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was an asshole -- you said it yourself. What are you grieving for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm grieving for myself, you fucking idiot! Ben lets it all go, sobbing for all the years of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know how you must have felt when your father was killed. Vitti looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it had to be ten times worse for you -- being murdered right in front of you. And you were so young -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really sobbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must've been so painful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes filling with tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you -- don't do this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's like all his hopes for you died with him. And that's so sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I go. You happy now?      You see what you're doing here? Both men are crying now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father really loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved him, too. I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugs him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. Jelly comes around the corner and sees the two men in a w embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy.    This is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another huge CRASH as the marshals ram the gates again, t time tearing loose one of the big hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we oughta should go. Vitti, Ben and Jelly run to the bus, but Eddie pulls a gu and stops them. Al and Bobby cover Jelly and the rest of crew. Vitti backs away slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really think you were gonna live through this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had my hopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, nice work.   Mr. Rigazzi will be very grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rigazzi? I thought he worked for Patti LoPresti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Patty thought, too. This scumbag's been playin' both sides against the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one side as far as I'm concerned. Mine. What did you think? I was just gonna stand by and let some fuckin' has-been move back in? So long, Mr. Vitti. He cocks the gun and is about to pull the trigger when Be suddenly roars and slams him in the head with his gun. Vi and Jelly quickly cover Al Pacino and Enormous Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beating the shit out of Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it anymore! That's what I hate about you fucking sociopaths! You just keep changing the rules to suit yourselves. Well, not this time, you anti-social asshole. You fucked with the wrong shrink! Sitting on Eddie's chest, he presses the gun against Eddi nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you read the papers?   The guy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the gun makes the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what? They shove Eddie, Enormous Bobby and Al Pacino into the b of the armored truck, Vitti gives a signal and the crane lifts it off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armored truck comes down fast and drops heavily to th street. Federal MARSHALS swarm the truck and find Eddie, and Bobby sprawled in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor! Face-down!   Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice goin'. Good plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a sociopath? The marshals handcuff them. Suddenly, the marshals hear AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE coming from the next block. Uniformed SWAT COPS come running from that direction and shout to the marshals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're escaping out the back!    Get over there! Move it! The marshals rush toward the sound of the GUNFIRE and disappear around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT BLOCK
dialogues.text: As the marshals round the corner, they see a police shoot in progress. Wiseguys are FIRING AUTOMATIC WEAPONS at cops who are pin down behind police cruisers. The Captain of the marshals FIRES a warning SHOT in the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! Drop your weapons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head wiseguy, Anthony Bella, turns in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his own bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut, cut, cut! What the hell's going on? Raoul strides out into the street, furious, still talking through his bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Captain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? What are you doing in my shot? The Captain and the marshals look around and see that the on the set of "Little Caesar."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing on my street? The Captain walks toward Raoul until they are almost face face, shouting at each other through their BULLHORNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a permit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about your permit! The ASSISTANT DIRECTOR addresses the TV crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, people. Back to one and let's try it again! (into his walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release the traffic and reset for another take. On the perimeters of the set, the PA's signal the off-dut cops who work the set to release the real traffic they've been holding on the cross streets. A city bus passes behind Raoul and Tony Bella who are sti screaming at the Federal Marshal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In mid-block, SWAT cops step into the street and wave the to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is sitting in the back with Vitti as the helmeted SWA cops board the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees them coming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. We're screwed. The cops walk toward the back and confront Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one tough shrink. The cops unmask. It's Mo-Mo, Cokes, and Tuna.     They la and slap hands with Vitti and Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls out and joins the flow of traffic heading downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the guys are looking pretty happy with their score. Ben turns to Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling pretty good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what now? You go on the run for the rest of your life? Back to Sing Sing? Or you turn up dead in an alley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are my choices? What   happened to lying on a beach in Costa  Rica for the next twenty years?   You can't let me enjoy this for  five fuckin' minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes?    And then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what?    I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Rigazzi company van is forced open by a team of FBI age by Agent Miller. Stacked inside are forty gold bars. Agent Cerrone comes out of the building with Lou Rigazzi several associates in handcuffs. U.S. Attorney Chapin makes a statement to the media.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acting on intelligence we developed in the last few days, the Justice Department and the F.B.I. took very aggressive action to recover the stolen gold and bring the perpetrators to justice. I'm happy to tell the people of New York that the streets are safe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti knocks on the front door.    Patty answers it in he robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Paul.   How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard. It's all over the television. I never should've trusted Eddie. But, you know, a woman alone in the world is very vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I don't have to worry about the Rigazzis no more. Thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- I just want to be left

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'll make sure. How about some breakfast? I could make you some waffles and -- whatever else you want. She adjusts her robe, providing Vitti a quick peek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do that. Patty smiles and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you ever change your mind -- (kisses him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is leaning against the railing gazing at the water wh Vitti walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Patti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ruefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she grab your balls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of question is that? She's cool. She's just happy to have 'the Wrench' out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I talked to the U.S. Attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he grab your balls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Paul, he did not grab my balls. He thanked me for tipping him off about the gold. And he said he won't be coming after you if you stay out of trouble.  So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go to Ohio -- get Marie and the kids -- then we'll probably disappear for awhile -- figure out all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: this future stuff -- away from all the pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. Change is hard, Paul.    But you did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you, too. You hung in there. That took a lot of guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you were like an animal back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just vented my displaced aggression

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm telling you. You're a monster. I saw the beast in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a beast. I can handle myself if I have to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handle yourself? You were fuckin' John Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wrestled a bit in high school -- 122 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could tell.   You're good, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You are good. You got a gift, my friend. Ben gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   I have a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- happy ending, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think so.   Don't you feel better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I feel like shit. All that work for nothing. 20 million bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're grieving -- it's a process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too, Paul. They embrace. Then Vitti starts to walk away toward Jelly who has been waiting at a respectful distance. Vitti stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc! (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'There's a place for us -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'A time and place for us -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joins in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Hold my hand we're halfway there -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Hold my hand and I'll take you there. (belting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, someday, somewhere.' The ORCHESTRA SWELLS as we CRANE UP TO the Brooklyn Bridg and Lower Manhattan beyond.

dialogues.speaker: FADED 8MM COLOR HOME MOVIE FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: A little boy in a cowboy suit sitting on a pony as his fa leads him around the ring.
